comment_text:
Thank you for supporting Not Forgotten over the years! They're making incredible strides towards breaking the cycle of abandonment. If you'd like to help with what we're doing, here are 2 things you can do:
Step 1: VOTE FOR THIS VIDEO https://www.projectforawesome.com/watch?v=-7xWPxsl5_s
Step 2: Support them on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/notforgotten
one of the most neglected places in my country... jungle kids have it rough

Hi Dustin, why do you think this video has the less amount of views on your channel, being maybe the most deep and important of all? I know you work on your statistics and, maybe you can come up with a sociological explanation, is it that we don't want to care? I admire your passion and share the same love for science. Please never stop being involved in this kind of acts, like supporting aboned childrens.
This video was not shown to me by YouTube and that is horrible!

This has great potential but its way too westernized.  What should be the focus is housing as many as possible.  Because, as you said, many, many thousands are in need.  They don't need jungle gyms, technology (except to learn with), they don't even need shoes.  (In fact feet are much stronger and offer much more support if shoeless.)  All they need is safety, security and compassion which you have well provided.  They should not be fed white rice.  brown rice, being unrefined is probably cheaper!  White rice is devoid of nutrition.  Starting them off with good food habits will add decades to their lifespan.  I don't know if you're growing food there but if not that would be great to integrate the children with.  Growth in nature gives us hope and those kids need hope.  Its just so very therapeutic.  I would think just getting out of the city into such a serene environment you've provided would do wonders for their psyche.  We so often take nature and all that God has so richly provided, for granted.
Nice work man!
Why are you doing this in foreign country to alien people? Disgusting. Help your own.

Your style of speaking and explanations is owesome as well as an element of compassion I am a big fan of your videos

This kind of work can be wonderful and is obviously needed. Fantastic job on that front. It is a shame that many of these programs, as this one does, includes proselytizing to these vulnerable children. I suppose the supporting religious institution(s) would be less anxious to assist if they did not, as the web sites refers to it, "demonstrates to our children, in both word and deed, what it means to have a personal relationship with Jesus Christ." But using programs like this to indoctrinate the young with faith based beliefs before they have gained critical thinking skills is both deceitful and insidious. Fortunately there are also many secular programs that do charitable work without holding the benefactors captive during lectures on supernatural dogma.

The thing that I have a question about is this: if 1/12 kids are being abandoned is any effort being made on the front end of that issue to prevent kids from being abandoned in the first place?  I look at this, and it is a wonderful thing that they are doing, but I can't imagine they are able to take in every abandoned child in need from the area, and I am wondering if there are preventative measures being put in place so that the cure, wonderful as it is, can become unnecessary.

I'm a United Methodist pastor and an avid space scientist since childhood. It is both refreshing and encouraging to see people in the science world who also have faith and the willingness to put that faith in action to make the world a better place. Granted, there are many intellectuals in the sciences whose hubris and lack of vision will not allow them to see a world in need. I pity them. HOWEVER, many of us believe in something greater than ourselves. I have met quite a few "big name" rocket scientists, astronomers and even a couple of moonwalkers (!) who have rock-strong faith in God. Destin, I am glad to see that you are one of those people. Please continue to inspire us!
Mahalo Destin!

My Dear Brother,
I have been following your channel for last one+ years. I “somehow”stumbled on this particular video. My wife is Peruvian. My 23 year old son is presently living in southern Peru. I have plans to return to Peru someday soon. At this time I am not employed and therefore I can not be a patreon at this time. But perhaps I will be able to do something more. Something clicked at time-marker 6:49. Perhaps we will be meeting. Solo si Dios quiere!

Destin.... you and your family are legends. While, I know you all wish you could solve all the worlds problems, and you are working with a slightly concentrated area. The positivity of this guy has been shining through in all his videos - and maybe, a part from that has been based on the knowing deep in his heart - that while I'm doing this awesome and unforgettable stuff (ie., living on a top secret US submarine under the Arctic ice, watching the US Coast Guard in their training, flying a helicopter or shooting a supersonic golf ball into a blob, etc, etc, etc) - I'm also helping big time some of those on the planet which are in need the most. Maybe the Destin we know wouldn't be possible without him knowing about the amazing, good stuff he's doing in the background. Watching this video today, on February 26, 2022 made me forget - for 10 minutes - the horrible reality of one my neighbouring countries - where the completely opposite is taking place now, real time - based on one ego-maniac's unfounded paranoia and unquenchable power-psychosis, where the aggressive forces of one country are killing people inside another country - where the only "wrongdoing" of the ones being killed - is living peacefully in their own country. Today, me being 40, will for the first time in my life donate medical supplies - to some of those on the planet currently in need the most. I don't know if I will feel the same kind of positivity for the rest of my life - but I just can't not do it. Well Done, Destin - for attempting to convince the world, again and again, that we the people here on earth - aren't evil, after all. Greetings from Latvia.

My only concern that’s more behind the scenes is if these homes are pushing religion (like Christianity) to these kids as part of their “help.” The only reason I bring this up is because it’s a common problem with some charities, non-profits, etc. in other countries. Meaning, the charity will help out with legitimate issues and needs, but will also indoctrinate people into whatever particular mythology the charity gets support from whether it’s Christianity, Mormonism, Islam, etc. That’s why every time I donate I always give to places like Doctors without Borders and other charities where I know man-made mythology will not be pushed onto any individual. Just something to consider. I’m assuming I’ll get hate on this msg from religious people as they always get angry when someone says something like this. It’s not about the mind-forged manacles and mythology though—my only concern is achieving positive goals for issues like this video mentioned, but doing so without any type of religious indoctrination. I just hope that makes sense… ❤️
